Title:
Project:
Behavior Tree Editor for Unity

Content: For the student project I worked on Junior year,
, I wanted to work on a tool used by designers and myself for making AI for our Souls Like game.
We decided on using behavior trees as our AI architecture and along with that a custom tool built into Unity for all of our editing needs.
This editor was used by designers and programmers to author all of the AI for our game.
Our development process consisted of starting off by quickly prototyping out a single attack / behavior of an Enemy with very little context,
then a designer layouts out on paper how an enemy should react to the player. Taking this outline a programmer (or a technical designer) makes a base tree (along with utility sub-trees)
with editable parameters using the Blackboard system.
Afterwards a designer fine tunes the tree and get the numbers _just right_ using the blackboard, as well as change nodes around and polish the AI based on play-testing data.
The main window looked like this:
(I tried my best to make is look as native Unity as possible by using their own editor assets)
The window on the left is the 'Inspector' / 'Blackboard' and the rest is the 'Canvas' where the nodes live.

Content.Content: Copy and Pasting of nodes (works across documents as well).
Live debugging of a Tree on a specific GameObject.
Blackboard with a variant datatype for defining variables.
Running of a behavior tree from within another tree.
Calling of C# functions through the 'Event' Node.
Canvas zooming in / out and panning.
Open Behavior Tree Asset with double clicking. (Similar to the Way Unity AnimatorController work)
